business.headline: Mutual funds sahi hai? Why so many Indians are betting big on SIPsIt took 50 years to build Rs 10 trillion in AUM from 1963 to 2013, but in just six more years, it reached Rs 23 trillion by 2019. As of August 2024, the AUM has tripled to Rs 66.70 lakh crore, demonstrating strong investor confidence.

Sensex dips 400 points, Nifty ends below 25,000; Tata Motors tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 398.13 points to 81,523.16 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 122.65 points to settle at 24,918.45.

Samsung plans global job cuts up to 30%, 1,000 layoffs likely in India: Report In India, Samsung has already begun offering severance packages to mid-level employees, with up to 1,000 jobs expected to be affected.
Tata Motors, Maruti, M&M: Why auto stocks are in red today Among the major components of the BSE Auto index, Tata Motors Ltd experienced the largest drop, falling by 5.60%.

Semicon 2024: 5 things PM Modi shared on India's semiconductor ambitionsSemicon India 2024: PM Modi shared a plan to create a workforce of 85,000 skilled professionals, including technicians, engineers, and R&D experts, who will be industry-ready in the coming years.

UBS sees 20% downside potential in Tata Motors stock. Should you hold or sell? UBS, which holds a "sell" rating on the stock, cited concerns that moderating demand, rising discounts, and the absence of new internal combustion engine and hybrid launches could severely impact JLR's financial performance by fiscal 2026.

Hindenburg questions Sebi chief Madhabi Buch's silence on Congress's new chargeHindenburg Research's statement comes after the Congress party raised fresh allegations about Buch's links to listed companies regulated by Sebi. The short-seller also said that Madhabi Puri Buch has remained silent on the accusations for weeks.

Suzlon Energy hits 5% upper circuit for 2nd straight day. More upside left?Suzlon Energy has seen its stock value more than triple in the last year, gaining 223% over the past 12 months and 102% in 2024 alone.

You can bet on India when chips are down: PM Modi at Semicon India 2024Semicon India 2024 is a three-day event aimed at showcasing India's semiconductor strategy and policies, with the goal of establishing the country as a global hub for semiconductor manufacturing.

Zomato shares hit 52-week high. Is there more upside? Global brokerage firms like Jefferies and JP Morgan have also shown optimism, maintaining a 'buy' recommendation. Jefferies set a target price of Rs 335 for Zomato, reinforcing the positive sentiment.
Explained: Why Tata Motors shares slumped nearly 6% today At 11:30 am, Tata Motors shares were trading 5.57% lower at Rs 977.80 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.
Sensex, Nifty gain in volatile trade, Tata Motors plunges 5%, Zomato up 3%The S&P BSE was up 106.96 points at 82,030.60, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 32.85 points to 25,073.95 at 11:20 am.

Samsung India layoffs: Tech giant set to cut 200 jobs, says reportSamsung layoffs: The job cuts will affect various departments, including mobile phones, consumer electronics, home appliances, and support functions.

Mahindra, Pidilite, Dr Reddy's refute conflict allegations involving Dhaval BuchMahindra & Mahindra, Dr. Reddy's Laboratories, and Pidilite Industries have refuted Congress's allegations of conflict of interest involving SEBI Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch's husband. The companies clarified their engagements with Dhaval Buch were based on his expertise and predate her SEBI tenure.

New toll rules: Pay only for distance covered, no charges for first 20 kmThe new toll rules are part of the revised National Highways Fee Rules, 2024, which now focus on a pay-as-you-go system based on the distance you travel beyond the initial 20 km.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO booked 8x on Day 2. Check expected listing gainsBajaj Housing Finance is offering its shares in the price range of Rs 66-70 each. Investors can apply for a minimum of 214 shares and in multiples thereafter.

Mutual fund assets hit record Rs 66 lakh crore in AugustData from the Association for Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) shows that inflows into equity mutual funds rose by 3% in August, reaching Rs 38,239 crore.

Noida's housing dream fades as proposed rate hike pushes homes out of reachNoida's once-affordable housing dream is slipping away as soaring property prices and a proposed circle rate hike threaten to push homeownership further out of reach for the urban middle class.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by rally in IT and pharma stocks The S&P BSE Sensex added 361.75 points to end at 81,921.29, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.70 points to close at 25,041.10.

US election risk looms over Wall Street, but there are bigger threatsRight now, Wall Street is facing some uncertain moments as investors keep a close eye on the US stock rally, with the presidential election and other big economic factors coming into play.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: BJP's 'anti-India friends' jab as Rahul Gandhi meets US lawmaker Ilhan OmarRahul Gandhi's meeting with Ilhan Omar, who is the representative for Minnesota's 5th congressional district, and is known for her critical stance on India, drew sharp criticism from the BJP.

Protesting doctors agree for talks with Mamata Banerjee, meeting today eveningOn Wednesday morning, doctors said they had agreed to a meeting and emailed the Chief Minister's Office. The government has asked the doctors to send a 10-15 member delegation for the meeting at the state secretariat at 6 pm today.

Sikhs protest outside Rahul Gandhi's house in Delhi over remarks in USRahul Gandhi's remark on the Sikh community has drawn a sharp reaction. On Wednesday, a BJP-backed Sikh group protested outside his residence in Delhi.

Actor Malaika Arora's father jumps to death from building terrace Bollywood actor and model Malaika Arora's father, Anil Arora, died by suicide after jumping off a building terrace on Wednesday, police said.

Vinesh Phogat claims lack of support during Olympic ordeal: What's the truth?India Today's Nikhil Naz dissects Vinesh Phogat's explosive claims about lack of support and politics during her Paris Olympic ordeal. The former wrestler accused Indian Olympic Association chief PT Usha of not supporting her in Paris. Vinesh returned empty-handed from the Olympics after her appeal against disqualification was rejected.

Explosion at US military facility in Baghdad ahead of Iranian president's visitAn explosion occurred at a site used by the US military near Baghdad airport late Tuesday, just before Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian's scheduled visit. Iraqi security forces are investigating the incident, which has not resulted in any immediate reports of damages or casualties.

Who is Ilhan Omar, US lawmaker whose meeting with Rahul Gandhi sparked row?The BJP criticised Rahul Gandhi's meeting with Ilhan Omar, alleging her anti-India stance on issues including Kashmir and the killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

'This was Kamala Harris's night': X users declare Democrat winner of debateThis was the first debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump after President Joe Biden ended his re-election bid in July.

Himachal student's violent ragging caught on camera, whipped for refusing alcohol The student filed a complaint with the police, stating that the final-year students had been harassing him for several days before they assaulted him two days ago.

Not a big diversion from how we think: Rahul Gandhi on PM's approach to US tiesRahul Gandhi, during his visit to the US, stated that his party's approach to ties with the US aligns with Prime Minister Modi's, acknowledging continuity in India's relationship with the US.

On abortions, Donald Trump flip-flops, advantage Kamala HarrisKamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, said Donald Trump's policies on abortion had no exception for rape or incest, which she called 'immoral'.

Amit Shah attacks Rahul Gandhi over 'anti-national statements' in USUnion Home Minister Amit Shah said Rahul Gandhi's statement "lays bare the Congress's politics of causing rifts on the lines of regionalism, religion, and linguistic differences".

Mutual funds sahi hai? Why so many Indians are betting big on SIPsIt took 50 years to build Rs 10 trillion in AUM from 1963 to 2013, but in just six more years, it reached Rs 23 trillion by 2019. As of August 2024, the AUM has tripled to Rs 66.70 lakh crore, demonstrating strong investor confidence.

I have a plan, said Kamala Harris in debate. The plan was added just a day ago"I have a plan, let us talk about our plans," Democratic candidate Kamala Harris challenged her Republican rival Donald Trump during their first presidential debate. The plan that Kamala Harris was flaunting was revealed just a day ago, and came after 50 days of Joe Biden withdrawing from the race.

You can bet on India when chips are down: PM Modi at Semicon India 2024Semicon India 2024 is a three-day event aimed at showcasing India's semiconductor strategy and policies, with the goal of establishing the country as a global hub for semiconductor manufacturing.

Hindenburg questions Sebi chief Madhabi Buch's silence on Congress's new chargeHindenburg Research's statement comes after the Congress party raised fresh allegations about Buch's links to listed companies regulated by Sebi. The short-seller also said that Madhabi Puri Buch has remained silent on the accusations for weeks.

Jayam Ravi's wife Aarti: Divorce announcement was made without my consentJayam Ravi's estranged wife Aarti Ravi shared her first statement regarding the dissolution of their marriage. In the statement, she explained that she was blindsided by Ravi's announcement, which was made without her consent.

The big US presidential debate: Lotus squelches former PotusRepublicans are morose, while Democrats are optimistic – in fact, so optimistic that they have offered a second debate. The biggest revelation of Tuesday night: Harris is a gun owner, something that was written about in 2019 but was not widely known.

Elon Musk's low blow to Taylor Swift: I'll give you a child, guard your catsElon Musk's remark came shortly after pop star Taylor Swift said she would be voting for Kamala Harris in the US presidential election in November following the latter's debate with Donald Trump.

We will never get humanity to Mars: Elon Musk over Starship delaysIn a strongly worded statement, Musk expressed frustration with what he calls "superfluous regulatory delays" holding up Starship flights.

Van Allen radiation belt: The dangerous path taken by Polaris DawnThese belts pose significant challenges for space travel. The high-energy particles trapped within them can damage spacecraft electronics and pose health risks to astronauts.

Locals, cops clash in Shimla during protest over 'illegal' construction in mosquePolice resorted to lathicharge and use of water cannons in order to disperse the angry protesters while they were on their way to the mosque.

Samsung plans global job cuts up to 30%, 1,000 layoffs likely in India: Report In India, Samsung has already begun offering severance packages to mid-level employees, with up to 1,000 jobs expected to be affected.
Mpox detected in India: Why WHO changed the name from monkeypoxThe use of the name "monkeypox" was associated with discrimination, following which the World Health Organisation renamed it "mpox."

Viral: Actor Sai Pallavi dances to Zingaat, Apsara Aali at sister's weddingActor Sai Pallavi dazzled at her sister Pooja's wedding, dancing to Zingaat, London Thumakda, and Apsara Aali. Videos of her graceful performance have gone viral on social media.

Video: Kareena-Saif, Ananya, Chunky Panday at Malaika Arora's family homeMany celebrities visited Malaika Aroroa's family home after finding out about her father's death. Malaika's father, Anil Arora,  died by suicide after jumping off a building terrace on Wednesday, police said. Her friend Kareena Kapoor visited her father's residence with husband Saif Ali Khan. Ananya Panday, accompanied by her father Chunky Panday was also there. Later, Shibani Dandekar was also clicked there.

Jayam Ravi and Aarti Ravi's relationship: A timelineJayam Ravi and Aarti were married for 15 years. While Ravi announced the dissolution of their marriage, Aarti claimed that it was made without her consent.

Committee formed to investigate sexual harassment in Bengali film industryChief Minister Mamata Banerjee has formed a committee, like Hema Committee, to investigate sexual harassment in the Bengali film industry. The news was shared by actor Ritabhari Chakraborty on Instagram.

sports.headline: World Cup 2023 generated total economic impact of Rs 11,637 crore to India The International Cricket Council published an economic report on Wednesday, highlighting the economic gains generated by the ODI World Cup 2023. The tournament, which was held from October 5 to November 19, contributed Rs 11,637 crore to the Indian economy.

Nathan Lyon names Rohit-Kohli and Pant as his 'Big 3' for Border Gavaskar seriesNathan Lyon named Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant as India's 'Big 3' batters for the upcoming Border Gavaskar Trophy series. The series will kickstart from this November.

Coach Julian Nagelsmann pleased with Germany's developmentGerman dreams of becoming a prominent contender at the World Cup in two years' time were strengthened following a thrilling performance against the Netherlands that won the approval of coach Julian Nagelsmann.

Chahal delighted after 5-wicket haul for Northants in landmark match Indian leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal was outstanding against Derbyshire after he finished with figures of 16.3-2-45-5 at the County Ground in Northampton.

Labuschagne charged for showing dissent at umpire's decisionAustralian batsman Marnus Labuschagne has been charged with umpire dissent following a heated exchange during a T20 Max semi-final. The incident took place during a match between Redlands and Valleys at Allan Border Field in Brisbane.

Michael Vaughan fires Jasprit Bumrah warning to in-form Joe Root for 2025 seriesFormer England captain Michael Vaughan feels India speedster Jasprit Bumrah will trouble the in-form Joe Root in the five-match series between two countries next year.

India hammer Malaysia 8-1 to complete hat-trick in title defenceAsian Champions Trophy Hockey: India came up with a superlative attacking performance to beat Malaysia 8-1 on Wednesday, September 11. A hat-trick from Raj Kumar Pal and brace from Hundal Araijeet Singh were the highlights of India's dominant show.

After Shakib, Mashrafe Mortaza charged for accused in Bangladesh unrestFormer captain Mashrafe Mortaza has been named amongst the 90 accused in connection with attacks on students during unrest in Bangladesh.

Ricky Ponting hails winner Rishabh Pant's comeback and return to Test cricketFormer Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting hailed Rishabh Pant's remarkable return to cricket. Pant would be returning to India's Test side in the 2-match series against Bangladesh.

T20 World Cup setback in the past, Marsh geared up for England challengeAustralia tour of England: Captain Mitchell Marsh said Australia are determined to do well in the upcoming limited-overs series, reflecting on the disappointment of the T20 World Cup exit. Australia play three T20Is and five ODIs in the UK.

Rohit Sharma returns to top 5 in ICC Test rankings ahead of Bangladesh seriesICC Test Rankings: India captain Rohit Sharma returned to the top five for the first time since 2021. Sri Lankan batters, including captain Dhananjaya de Silva and opener Pathum Nissanka, made significant gains after their productive outings in a recently concluded three-Test series in England.

A hat-trick from Raj Kumar Pal and brace from Hundal Araijeet Singh were the highlights of India's dominant show.

Australia play three T20Is and five ODIs in the UK.

Sri Lankan batters, including captain Dhananjaya de Silva and opener Pathum Nissanka, made significant gains after their productive outings in a recently concluded three-Test series in England.

Who is Jacob Bethell? England set to unleash new 'superstar' ENG vs AUS: Jacob Bethell will be among the three debutants for England when the hosts lock horns with Australia in the opening T20I at the Rose Bowl in Southampton.

Greater Noida Test: Despite 3-day washout, AFG v NZ can produce result. Here's howThe one-off Test between Afghanistan and New Zealand has seen back-to-back washouts on the first three days. However, the match can still produce a result, with the apt use of MCC Laws.

Tilak Varma 'focussing on game as an all-rounder' to rise through domestic ranksTilak Varma revealed that he has been focussing on emerging as an all-rounder in red-ball cricket and would use the ongoing domestic season to showcase his prowess. He didnt feature in India A's playing XI in round one.

Vinesh Phogat claims lack of support during Olympic ordeal: What's the truth?India Today's Nikhil Naz dissects Vinesh Phogat's explosive claims about lack of support and politics during her Paris Olympic ordeal. The former wrestler accused Indian Olympic Association chief PT Usha of not supporting her in Paris. Vinesh returned empty-handed from the Olympics after her appeal against disqualification was rejected.

OTD in 2023: Kohli-Rahul's hundreds power India to biggest win over PakistanOn this day last year, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul's blistering hundreds guided India to their biggest-ever win over Pakistan in Asia Cup 2023. India won the contest by 228 runs against Pakistan.

New coach Mauricio Pochettino promises 'something special' for USA football The USA senior national men's team appointed former Chelsea boss Mauricio Pochettino as their new head coach on Tuesday. The Argentine tactician said the decision to join the USA team was influenced by more than just football.

PM Modi's heartfelt letter for PR Sreejesh: 'The wall between victory and defeat' Prime Minister Narendra Modi wrote a heartfelt letter for former India hockey player PR Sreejesh hailing him for his contribution in the national team.

Kieron Pollard unleashes six-hitting prowess to guide TKR to win in CPL 2024 Kieron Pollard rewind the clock as he unleashed his six-hitting prowess during the match between Trinbago Knight Riders and St Lucia Kings at CPL 2024. Pollard hit an unbeaten fifty to guide TKR to the win.

OTD in 2023: Kohli-Rahul's hundreds power India to biggest win over PakistanOn this day last year, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul's blistering hundreds guided India to their biggest-ever win over Pakistan in Asia Cup 2023. India won the contest by 228 runs against Pakistan.

The Argentine tactician said the decision to join the USA team was influenced by more than just football.

Vinesh Phogat says no support from PT Usha, 'politics' played during Olympics sagaFormer India wrestler Vinesh Phogat has accused Indian Olympic Association President PT Usha for not providing her support during the Paris Olympics 2024.

Rohit Sharma reveals goofy 1% side apart from rigorous training in Insta postRohit Sharma shared a video on his Instagram where he showcased and revealed his 1% goofy side apart from being involved in training the rest 99% of the time.

AFG vs NZ: Persistent rain in Greater Noida washes out play on Day 3 of the TestThe Day 3 of the one-off Test between Afghanistan and New Zealand was once again abandoned due to incessant rain at the Greater Noida Sports Complex Ground.

OTD 2007: Chris Gayle gets T20 World Cup off the mark with a breathtaking hundredOn September 11, 2007 West Indies batter Chris Gayle played a scintillating knock of117 (57) in the first match of maiden edition of the T20 World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
